poem:
Title: Architectural Resonance  

Brick by defiant brick, ambition ascends,
In Peckham shadows, a dream's monument unfolds.
Walls bloom, trailing thoughts to heaven's doors,
Embodying the heart's whisper, and its bold roars.
Monolith-cum-lacework of gregarious urban strand,
Dream architects dredging wonder from the land.
In one red-brick breath, a rebellion stands,
Chiselled by youth's restless, unyielding hands.
